name: jls8510
text: A comment left by jls8510 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by StoatLad, katsura, GeyserShitdick, trisha, cryptfiend85, woodenteeth, mystkmanat, Mastronaut)

name: wehavemagnums
text: A comment left by wehavemagnums was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ajg, _cheesekayke, mystkmanat, jmmfgd)

name: catachresis
text: Would easily be a 5 if it wasn't for the fact that very often, Achewood is even better than this.

name: juancarlos
text: "Aw, man" and "I hate days like today" thing is what made it a five for me. Ray is more disappointed than mad for having such an un-rad day.

name: stormagnet
text: Seriously. If we only get to rate up to five, we need the option of rating to at least 3 decimals.

name: garlic_breath
text: A comment left by garlic_breath was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, riotdejaneiro, cmjhogan, GeyserShitdick, mike24, Connellingus, JuanCarlos, Dainbramage, pogo)

name: garlic_breath
text: A comment left by garlic_breath was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, Overmedicated, capslock_annliv, cmjhogan, GeyserShitdick, mike24, Connellingus, joebot, pogo)

name: aaron_haynes
text: A comment left by aaron_haynes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, JuanCarlos, Jesus)

name: senseihollywood
text: A comment left by senseihollywood was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, Jesus, Zem)

name: senseihollywood
text: A comment left by senseihollywood was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by alphagator, Vice, pitseleh, Zem, Wulvaine, Darthemed)

name: soylimpio
text: that is a low shenanigan

name: dovey
text: 2 Lames from bass players

name: gormster
text: Ohoho... next you're going to be saying you hate Tool and the Chili Peppers. Even if you do, you're not supposed to say it.

name: senseihollywood
text: well... I hear he's a vegan, so I don't know about the nachos, but I definitely wouldn't put it past Flea not to piss in an empty...or on the walls...or an airline seat...etc...

name: senseihollywood
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: mastronaut
text: I HATE tool and I play bass.

name: tim_simmons
text: tool are basically what 16 year olds listen to when they  want 'grow musically' that is, they get tired of cradle of filth or metallica or other such music

name: tim_simmons
text: also its what they listen to when they turn into giant asses

name: farqussus
text: EVERYONE who hates on tool liked tool at one stage and/or secretly still do but are afraid of the social repercussions. I hate tool for making Undertow four times in a row. Why do YOU hate tool?

name: mastronaut
text: Pretty much for making undertow four times in a row. I can't deny the talent in the group but the fact that the band has progressed none over their entire career says something about them.

name: gormster
text: No, I never liked Tool.

name: bixschmix
text: Yeah, not true. I am proud to say that I have never, ever, EVER liked tool.

name: farqussus
text:
A: You're a purportedly a woman, so you would never in your right mind even pretend to like tool anyway.

B: Do you HATE Tool, and tell everyone how much they are shit with gusto at inopportune moments?

But do you HATE Tool?

name: farqussus
text: goddamn it. i give up.

name: zhankfor
text: Shit with gusto! That's a new one.

name: senseihollywood
text:
Shit with gusto is pretty much the ingredient list for a Bullshit Sunrise.

that and splash of grenadine...

name: spinynorman
text: I liked Tool. I was twelve. I'm fine with that.

name: charchar
text:
I pretended to like Tool and Dream Theater to win my father's love (he is a prog-rocker). I came out of the post-punk closet when I was fourteen, and I can still see him staring down Gary Numan on my shirt, all like, " what the cock is this shit? " and I squeaked " it's a synthesiser and he hasn't any eyebrows ." I felt so brave and so scared.

We don't talk music anymore.

name: philophobe
text:
Maybe...maybe the best comment ever?

As a devoted metalhead who also loves all sorts of fey indie and folk precociousness such as Belle & Sebastian and Joanna Newsom, I too, friend, have suffered all conceivable depredations.

name: idsyen
text:
I liked Tool. I actually liked them a lot. It was very difficult for me to come to the understanding that they are maybe not so swell, but after much soul searching I realized that they not only play every song in the same key, but only use one chord for every song... the same chord! All the complex rhythms in the world don't make your music sophisticated if you only got one damn chord.

The chord is d minor.

name: senseihollywood
text: the saddest of all keys...

name: soticoto
text:
I liked Tool.
I still like Tool.
I also like Cradle of Filth.

But see, unlike a lesser man, I will not get on your case for having a difference of opinion. In fact I will chubb you for it, partly because I really DON'T like Metallica and never did.

As for everyone else posting after... they can go fuck themselves.

name: soylimpio
text: often the more interesting comments are marked lame.  Oddly, no one says comments that just repeat a punchline are lame.

name: relaxing
text: Sometimes it is rad to repeat a punchline.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Give me a little credit, I used a previous punchline to illustrate my point.

name: rowboat
text: I used to be a "word-for-word line repeater" lamer. Then I got religion. I still cringe, though. Especially when said repeater has, like, 15 chubbies. What gives?

name: heccibiggs
text:
I know, I can't stand it. It's like, yes, we all read the comic.

It's even worse on YouTube. I've learned to not scroll down on YouTube pages because I just get angry.

name: rowboat
text: Oh, god. Yeah, even the worst trolls here (NOT talking about you, aaron_haynes) are more intellectually stimulating than 99% of Youtube posters. That sounds like an elitist, asshole remark, and I suppose it is. But DAMN! Talk about the lowest form of written English! It's a linguistic bloodbath!

name: heccibiggs
text: Talk about people who eat nachos with every meal!

name: tekende
text:
Man, they wish. They're people who would eat nachos for every meal, except they can't figure out how to make nachos. So they eat Nacho Cheese Doritos instead.

"It's basically the same thing," they tell themselves.

name: rowboat
text: Oh, shit....this is starting to hit a little too close to home....

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I always preferred Nacho Cheese Doritos to actual nachos; it was like all the good part of nachos but hey no vegetables.

Then I turned 30.

name: rowboat
text: When you turn thirty, vegetables turn awesome. Especially ones like jalapenos, which provide a level of flavor long forgotten by those who have been smoking since they were sixteen.

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, jimbob, yingkaixing)

name: aaron_haynes
text: The phrasing in this strip is among the best Achewood's ever done, especially panel 6.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: I think is funny how Tèodor is the one to point out the ad to ray.

name: rumblefish
text: I think he probably realised that his prank would really only lead to Ray getting mad rutty with a fiery Puerto Rican (can I say that?) woman that kept pushing a bottle of Pink Zin and a pair of handcuffs towards him and winking.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray's just chillin' in his hot tub, drinking a margarita, waiting for someone to call.

name: crinklebat
text:
I just - man, I must not have read this one too carefully the first time, because "Say, are you all split on green? Is this some kind of low shenanigan? " is the kind of pair of sentences that ought to stick with a girl always.

Boy howdy, it's like Shakespeare up in this.

name: rowboat
text: I sometimes forget how often Teodor is split on green. He's very high functioning stoner. And before you lame me, I would like to inform you that in all seriousness no pun was intended, there. I don't mean "Ha, no pun intended!" as if to say "Yes, I actually did intend that." Seriously....no....no....NO....DON'T DO IT!

name: rowboat
text: But you can lame me for broken English. Do.

name: farqussus
text: I would lame you for oversensitivity. But that's hypocritical. Can we still be friends?

name: heccibiggs
text: I'm going to assume that lame was from rowboat, and is his way of saying no, you can't still be friends.

name: rowboat
text: Your assumption is incorrect, hecci. I safeguard my seemingly tiny lame allotment as one would bullets in an undead outbreak. I can only hope that you're enough of a nerd to understand this metaphor.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Of course I am.

P.S. The fact that we have two sets of comment-correspondence on one page means we're now best friends forever.

name: rowboat
text:
Word. Let's shake on it.

P.S. I'm no creep.

name: layzerblade
text: I wouldn't call Téodor a high-functioning stoner because I wouldn't call him high-functioning, period. He seems to coast through life, and pot helps him. Téodor represents Onstad without Achewood, a Bizarro version of Onstad who still, in his thirties, hasn't found a project to devote himself to. Onstad seems to genuinely like and care for Téodor, but there's always this melancholy tint of gratitude that Onstad hasn't become him.

name: bixschmix
text: Chubbied for the phrase "boy howdy, it's like shakespeare up in this." I think I've said that exact phrase recently. You and I may be identical twins separated at birth who have only found each other through the magic of Achewood.

name: stuart
text: HELL YES I can still sport wood!

name: tttt
text: classic just for the use of 'along' instead of 'on'

name: ferdinand
text: it's a bit of a stretch to call white zin 'wine.'

name: ford
text: ahm, but what about PINK zin?

name: ferdinand
text: ah.  yes.  my bad.  to clarify: anything other than red zin, preferably old vine, or the italian primitivo from which the varietal probably evolved, is like what the kool-aid man pisses after drinking lite beer.

name: jlynes
text: A fine simile that I hope to one day use in everyday conversation.  Bravo, ma'am.  Chubby to you.

name: ford
text: that was the most excellent way in which i have ever been corrected.  enjoy your chubby sir.

name: boredom_man
text: Where were you when you first discovered the existence of white merlot?

name: tropicana
text: White zinfandel is the cranberry juice of wines.

name: geysershitdick
text: To celebrate his birthday, Ray ate Nachos at every meal.

name: clever-nickname
text: The alt-text makes me giggle like no other

name: sp1derbaby
text: Guitar pedantry... must... not... comment...

name: snowman
text: "along" is AMAZING.

name: canusdivinus
text: Aw, T-adore, you rushed it. Gotta let someone ELSE point it out when you're gonna prank somebody in this way.

name: mattbeetee
text: I don't mean to be all cliche up in everybody's grills, but this is my favourite strip and I wanted you to know this.

name: desert_donkey
text: this kind of shit happens to me ALL THE TIME.

name: poodlelucy
text: absolutely brilliant alt text.

name: bozendoka
text: 5, esp. for panel 3.  Next 4 will be a 5 for dropped tuning.

name: lucobrazzi88
text: fWHeW! i almost pistol whipped ray.

name: andrewthepig
text:
Eating nachos at every meal. That is just dogshit .

That is something Caligula would do

name: fineoakstructure
text: I love this strip so much.  Every word is written so perfectly.  Reading this strip is like riding a swan in a lake of vanilla pudding.  Also there is wine.
